content: yes, yes: force of affirmative repetition, unique call of the to-come as the will to repeat itself, affirmation that cites itself, joyous EROS, immeasurable unhappiness, irreducible contamination, affirmation risks citation, le oui qui fait dans la langue un trou aussi étrange que viens, il approuve, affirme, contresigne tout ce “qui est arrivé”

linkedContent: eternal ring, passivity of nonpower, strength in reception, restarts alliance w/out debt, gift w/out credit

linkedContent: the gift w/out knowing (sans le savoir), the sole possible, the impossible

content: le désir de toucher au bord a eu lieu (has taken place), the touching has not, not arrived at its term, sa rive, sa marge ou son bord, sa berge (bank) (ce qui garde et met à l’abri, contre une chute ou une noyade)

content: border of approach dissimulates itself w/out presenting itself elsewhere
linkedContent: border of approach dissimulates itself w/out presenting itself elsewhere

content: to land, to approach is what creates a border, to approach a strange slow movement of drawing near, does not attain goal, nor tamper with end, does not touch the border, which only remains one so long as approaching never touches it [border of approach ≈ to-come of event]
linkedContent: to land, to approach is what creates a border, to approach a strange slow movement of drawing near, does not attain goal, nor tamper with end, does not touch the border, which only remains one so long as approaching never touches it [border of approach ≈ to-come of event]

content: approach is not an originary event
linkedContent: approach is not an originary event

content: ne-pas, not negation brought to bear on a position or a negation, but on “singular undecidability of the approach of the other”—unable to go nearer or father: suffice to disable every dialectical schema
linkedContent: ne-pas, not negation brought to bear on a position or a negation, but on “singular undecidability of the approach of the other”—unable to go nearer or father: suffice to disable every dialectical schema

content: Blanchot: ideal negation, deferred assassination that is language, my language does not kill anyone (woman can always die, her death announced, already present in my language)
linkedContent: Blanchot: ideal negation, deferred assassination that is language, my language does not kill anyone (woman can always die, her death announced, already present in my language)

content: Blanchot’s example of how speaking negates the existent of which it speaks: ‘This woman!’ > Hölderlin, Mallarmé, all poets, felt act of naming is marvelous/disquieting
linkedContent: Blanchot’s example of how speaking negates the existent of which it speaks: ‘This woman!’ > Hölderlin, Mallarmé, all poets, felt act of naming is marvelous/disquieting

content: faire trembler d’abord (trembling, first approach): denial of fear, frightens more, a fascination, la moindre possibilité de s’arriver, in trembling one renounces mastery, use, domination, one does not know how to sign its effects > pas d’insistance distances itself on first approach
linkedContent: faire trembler d’abord (trembling, first approach): denial of fear, frightens more, a fascination, la moindre possibilité de s’arriver, in trembling one renounces mastery, use, domination, one does not know how to sign its effects > pas d’insistance distances itself on first approach

content: Blanchot come is said so that elle can cry out its name
linkedContent: Blanchot come is said so that elle can cry out its name

content: cette femme, not yours, but the name for you, not a part of you, doesn’t possess you, addresses you > [she responds?] my name is unique, and you hide it, forget it
linkedContent: cette femme, not yours, but the name for you, not a part of you, doesn’t possess you, addresses you > [she responds?] my name is unique, and you hide it, forget it

content: death as the impossibility of dying, à partir de laquelle s’annonce la mort sans mort ——faux pas de mort
linkedContent: death as the impossibility of dying, à partir de laquelle s’annonce la mort sans mort ——faux pas de mort

content: if being is another name for forgetting, places forgetting in a crypt, forgets forgetting, in naming forgetting one makes it disappear under its name [(un)names], vs. pas sous le nom d’oubli > le reste sans reste de cet effacement qui ne s’efface plus, voilà ce qu’il y a peut-être, par chance, mais qui n’est pas ou qui est pas

content: dissemination does not play w/ the multiple, plural, dispersion, the apart (épars), but with the unique, the unique and itself
linkedContent: dissemination does not play w/ the multiple, plural, dispersion, the apart (épars), but with the unique, the unique and itself

content: to give must forget all the way up to what is given, one gives without having self (sans s’avoir) [see p. (23) say “come” w/out knowing, having, seeing]

content: forgetting must guard itself (se guarder) to preserve the gift, so the gift can give, the bank (berge) and contamination poison the gift

content: Blanchot: this laughter ran along border of space, w/out crossing it, seemed to be that space

content: must be able to reject the gift, vomir ce qui t’appelle à dire viens, forget in order to reject the poison, to not guard the gift

content: the event adrift (en dérive) abducts (enlève) its simple past from an indefinite background of habitus or repetition, fond sans fond [quasi-now of récit]

content: decision not only suspended but understood (sous-entendue), I say understood, btwn 2 readings

content: if I write slowly you can hear si j’étais là (if/yes I was there) in three ways

content: the inner rhythm of sauf (contamination), always altered, always unscathed, “j’ai tout, sauf…” > “sauf que je voudrais en être débarrassé”

content: “il faut: laisser indemne, ne pas laisser indemne, quoi? tout, sauf—le sauf qu’il faut laisser indemne, ne pas laisser indemne”

content: in a moment of extreme, precipitous virtuosity, where o (mort, fors, faux, faut, zéro, mot) resonates everywhere and nom turns to mon, Derrida asks himself if his policing overzealousness [to unmask the absence of the name, le pas-de-nom] deciphers identities [maur/chot, m’: o], wants to catch everything in a dragnet (filet)
linkedContent: in a moment of extreme, precipitous virtuosity, where o (mort, fors, faux, faut, zéro, mot) resonates everywhere and nom turns to mon, Derrida asks himself if his policing overzealousness [to unmask the absence of the name, le pas-de-nom] deciphers identities [maur/chot, m’: o], wants to catch everything in a dragnet (filet)

content: border edge, hidden vicinity (un voisinage caché) [not depth]
linkedContent: border edge, hidden vicinity (un voisinage caché) [not depth]

content: structure of name, text, signature complicates premises when one precipitates oneself toward the guarantee of filiation [does jealousy always overdetermine?]

content: acc. Derrida, all [?] Blanchot’s books concern fascinating ellipsis (l’ellipse fascinante) of what leaves the sea

content: o as degree 0 (of appearance), double 0 as “power of 0 and 2” > the pas de Sans-Nom, EROS, neither gathers, identifies, nor excludes the one or the other

content: even if we could cite everything (read everything), the whole would still be lacking

content: when I say viens, I scream (hurle) and hold back (retiens) a murmur no one can hear

content: death, the other name of viens (both only reach the other)

content: when you say “I love you” does that make me unique?
linkedContent: when you say “I love you” does that make me unique?

content: must forget the question of your self, of your uniqueness, and love viens, the unique, not a name, not an impersonal infinitive

content: friendship gives anonymity in the name, if it is possible, it hands over (livre) le nom sans nom

content: in blanchâtre is cachalot, sperm-whale displaced in each syllable, economy of the syllable

content: if there was one [name], the signature, the anagrammatic, would lose name in infinite measure of its keeping [absolute guard], so > plus de nom (visible name might hide tout autre name)

content: name is no more its infinitely divisible elements than it is dispersed in them like foam in anonymous sea [Kant’s simple/composite]
linkedContent: name is no more its infinitely divisible elements than it is dispersed in them like foam in anonymous sea [Kant’s simple/composite]

content: ces mots le blanchâtre près de l'eau (j'y entends le déplacement silencieux, dissimulé d'un cachalot, sperm-whale)
linkedContent: ces mots le blanchâtre près de l'eau (j'y entends le déplacement silencieux, dissimulé d'un cachalot, sperm-whale)

content: double band is structure of name said to be proper, anonymity is the effect, whether by monumentalization (sauf, the unscathed) or effacement (seeds, dispersion); gift of name is corrupted in advance dans le pas-de-nom [plus-de-nom] > what takes place in and beyond language: leaves the fold of this folding back

content: mais la vigilance de l’autre peut aussi rester: 1) lose your name 2) can’t/don’t want to throw it away

content: Blanchot: “friendship for the demand to write which excludes all friendship”

content: I call to you to protect you against the nameless

content: Blanchot: solemn and noble procession toward what goal? and then forgetfulness came

content: Blanchot: prophets birth tongues, and feel desires they can’t support—before the immensity
